answers.answer: Hmm Andriol tou say! I want some
have your been screened for BPH? Had a PSA? Time to get to a urologist...

question: I am a 60 year old man. No diabetes, high BP or general health problems. I do have  low testosterone, having twice tested. Once gave the  LOW level of  the female range. A second test a year later after exercise and diet gave a reading at the lowest end of the male range. I am considering HRT. I have tried Testosterone Undeconate (?) capsules (Andriol). They certainly increased my libido and general "male drive", not just sexually. I have not used them for months however.I am sexually active. Over the years my ejaculate remained normal, thick, white but much decreased in volume as I aged. Starting about two months ago, my ejaculate volume has shot up. I am ejaculating about 3 to 5 x more. However, it is  watery and thin and pale. I used to be able to projectile ejaculate about 5 feet. This disappeared with age. Now I am shooting ejaculate again, but that is because it's watery. My first ejaculation after a week of inactivity is  slightly thick, but pale. A second orgasm in 24 hrs produces very very thin ejaculate, but many times the previous volume.
title: Abnormal increase in Ejaculate Volume
